meanings.definition: To summarize or review the main points of something.
meanings.sent1: After reading the book, she enjoyed recapping the story for her friend.
meanings.sent2: I like recapping my day before going to bed to remember all the important events.
meanings.sent3: Recapping the movie plot to her cat, she realized how silly it sounded.
meanings.sent4: Her mind was like a busy bee, constantly recapping memories and thoughts.
meanings.sent5: Recapping the lesson with colorful drawings helped her remember it better.

meanings.definition: A summary or review of the main points of something.
meanings.sent1: The teacher asked the students to write a recapping of the chapter for homework.
meanings.sent2: I always find it helpful to read the recapping at the end of a scientific article.
meanings.sent3: The recapping of the meeting made everyone laugh with its funny illustrations.
meanings.sent4: Her notebook was filled with neat recappings of each lecture, making studying easier.
meanings.sent5: The recapping of the play in the newspaper was so detailed, it felt like watching it again.

meanings.definition: The act of putting a new cap on something, such as a tire.
meanings.sent1: He learned how to do the recapping of tires at the auto repair shop.
meanings.sent2: Recapping the bottle with a fresh cap kept the soda from going flat.
meanings.sent3: The recapping of the pen with a new cap made it write smoothly again.
meanings.sent4: She enjoyed the recapping process of her favorite markers after each use.
meanings.sent5: The recapping of the water bottle was quick and easy with the twist-on cap.
